item.name: GET accesstoken (Step 1 - obtain a valid token)

exec: console.log(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Getting an access token using the SACtokenFQND as part of the access token URL');
else if (SAC_platform==='CF') // we are on a Cloud Foundary Platform
console.warn(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Invalid SACplatform setting, assuming CF. Supported values: NEO, CF. SACplatform: '+ SAC_platform);
console.log(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': SACserviceFQDN : '+pm.variables.get("SACserviceFQDN")+' (not used in this request)');
pm.environment.set("accesstoken", jsonData.access_token);  // setting the accesstoken so its re-used for all subsequent requests
pm.environment.set("x-csrf-token", "fetch");               // we will need to request a new csrf-token as we have a new session

console.info(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Great! A valid accesstoken was obtained. This means your SACtokenFQDN, SACplatform, Username and Password are all valid. You can now test the SCIM endpoint. The accesstoken provided was '+jsonData.access_token+' and will be re-presented in the header of subsequent requests');

console.info(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': If the identify provider, '+pm.environment.get("SACtokenFQDN")+', is hosted on the SAP Business Technology Platform then you can use the following URL in a web browser to observe the full SAML response which includes the \'attributes\' available to SAP Analytics Cloud. This is often very helpful when troubleshooting SAML attribute mapping issues. The URL is >>>>>>>>  https://'+pm.environment.get("SACtokenFQDN")+'/config?action=who&details=true&trustMigrationOnly=true  <<<<<<<<');
pm.execution.setNextRequest();                                  // let the next request run (if being run in the runner)
console.error(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Invalid username or password: '+ pm.response.text());
console.error(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Unhandled error. Check your SACtokenFQDN is set correctly. Response Body: '+ pm.response.text());

item.name: FETCH csrf token (Step 2 - read general API endpoint)

exec: console.info(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Reading general API endpoint to obtain a new x-csrf-token. This will validate if the SACserviceFQDN is valid or not. It will also validate the general API endpoint');
console.log(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': SACtokenFQDN   : '+pm.variables.get("SACtokenFQDN")+' (not used in this request)');
console.log(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': SACplatform    : '+pm.variables.get("SACplatform")+' (not used in this request)');
console.log(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Username       : '+pm.variables.get("Username")+' (not used in this request)');
console.log(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': accesstoken    : '+pm.variables.get("accesstoken")+' (obtained from the token URL endpoint and re-presented to this endpoint)');
console.log(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Now making a request to the general API endpoint...');
// we are not authorised, so our accesstoken or the csrf-token must be invalid. We shall get new ones of each!
// A 401 error might be because something is wrong with the call or even the SAP SAC SCIM API, so we need to start counting errors,
// so we don't end up in an endless loop.
if (!errors) { errors=0 };  // in case errors has not yet been set we need to set it to 0
console.log(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Fetching a new access token');
pm.execution.setNextRequest("GET accesstoken"); // once a new accesstoken is successfully returned this call will be repeated thanks to the 'recovery' variable set in the pre-request
console.log(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': SAP Analytics Cloud is receiving too many requests. Retrying in '+retryafter+'ms');
console.info(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Great! A valid x-csrf-token was fetched from the /csrf endpoint. This means the general API of SAP Analytics Cloud is available');
// we got an unexpected response from the SAC API
if (!errors) { errors=0 };  // in case errors has not yet been set we need to set it to 0

const maxerrors=parseInt( (pm.environment.get("abort_after_continous_errors_reaches")!=undefined) ? parseInt(pm.environment.get("abort_after_continous_errors_reaches")) : 3 );  // maxerrors should be at least 2 to allow for recovery of invalid access token and csrf tokens
// it means a setting of 1 would mean any call following would not be allowed to re-attempt the call.
// a setting of 3 is recommended to allow at least 1 re-attempted call and any subsequent call also failing for a potentially different reason
console.error(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Too many continuous errors. Aborting. Response: '+ pm.response.text());
console.warn(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Continuous errors detected. Response: '+ pm.response.text());

console.log(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Reading SCIM API endpoint to obtain total user count. This will validate if the SACserviceFQDN is valid or not. It will also validate the SCIM API endpoint which requires the OAuth Service \'User Provisioning\'');
pm.test("Single Environment Setup OK for SCIM", function ()
// we are authorised and the csrf-tokem is also valid. We need to set the x-csrf-token so the call is quicker.
// Performing a 'fetch' of the x-csrf-token makes the call longer and its unnecessary. Setting the x-csrf-token to a valid value
// will speed things up by a small fraction (which can be a lot of time if making thousands of calls!)

console.error(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': A HTTP 401 status was returned. This means this session is not authorised, likely due to an invalid access token, or your OAuth Client has not been granted the \'User Provisioning\' access. Response Body: '+ pm.response.text());

console.info(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Great! A valid response was obtained and means your SACserviceFQDN is set correctly. This SAP Analytics Cloud Service has '+total_users_in_this_SAC_service+' users. It means your OAuth Client has been granted the \'User Provisioning\' access');
// checking SAMLSSO Environment variable is set

console.warn(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': SAMLSSO                              : Undefined! Variable set as \'default\' for you. Please update the environment variable SAMLSSO if SSO is enabled. Supported values: default, userid, email and custom');

console.error(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': SAMLSSO                              : '+samlsso+'  (not set correctly. Please update the environment variable SAMLSSO to be: default, userid, email or custom)');
console.warn(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': abort_after_continous_errors_reaches : Undefined! Variable set as \'3\' for you.');

console.warn(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': TimeZoneHours                        : Undefined! Variable set as \'0\' for you. Please update the environment variable TimeZoneHours to be a number between -23 and 23');

console.warn(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': TimeZoneMinutes                      : Undefined! Variable set as \'0\' for you. Please update the environment variable TimeZoneMinutes to be -30, 0 or 30');

console.warn(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': TimeZoneDescription                  : Undefined! Variable set as \'UTC\' for you. Please update the environment variable TimeZoneDescription to be the description of your timezone');

const preferredlanguage                 =pm.environment.get("SCIM_NewUserDefault_preferredlanguage");  // possible values: 'ar', 'bg', 'zh-CN', 'zh-TW', 'hr', 'ca', 'cs', 'cy', 'nl', 'da', 'en', 'en-GB', 'fi', 'fr', 'fr-CA', 'de', 'de-CH', 'el', 'he', 'hi', 'hu', 'id', 'it', 'ja', 'ko', 'ms', 'no', 'pl', 'pt', 'pt-PT', 'ro', 'ru', 'sh', 'sk', 'sl', 'es', 'es-MX', 'sv', 'th', 'tr', 'uk', 'vi', 'en-US-sappsd' and possibly more will be added over time!

const dataaccesslanguage                =pm.environment.get("SCIM_NewUserDefault_dataaccesslanguage"); // possible values: 'zz' (default), 'af', 'ar', 'bg',  ... many more as shown above in preferredlanguage.
const dateformatting                    =pm.environment.get("SCIM_NewUserDefault_dateformatting");     // possible values include: 'MMM d, yyyy', 'dd/MM/yyyy', 'MM.dd.yyyy', ... many more!
const timeformatting                    =pm.environment.get("SCIM_NewUserDefault_timeformatting");     // possible values include: 'H:mm:ss' (24H), 'h:mm:ss A' (12H)
const systemnotificationsemailoptin     =pm.environment.get("SCIM_NewUserDefault_systemnotificationsemailoptin"); // possible values: 'true' or 'false' are valid, unlike 'TRUE' or 'FALSE'
const marketingemailoptin               =pm.environment.get("SCIM_NewUserDefault_marketingemailoptin");                    // possible values: 'true' or 'false' are valid, unlike 'TRUE' or 'FALSE'
console.log(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': New users will be created with the following values for their respective properties:');

pm.environment.set("SCIM_NewUserDefault_preferredlanguage", "en");    // possible values: 'ar', 'bg', 'zh-CN', 'zh-TW', 'hr', 'ca', 'cs', 'cy', 'nl', 'da', 'en', 'en-GB', 'fi', 'fr', 'fr-CA', 'de', 'de-CH', 'el', 'he', 'hi', 'hu', 'id', 'it', 'ja', 'ko', 'ms', 'no', 'pl', 'pt', 'pt-PT', 'ro', 'ru', 'sh', 'sk', 'sl', 'es', 'es-MX', 'sv', 'th', 'tr', 'uk', 'vi', 'en-US-sappsd' and possibly more will be added over time!

console.warn(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': SCIM_NewUserDefault_preferredlanguage                        : Undefined! Variable set as \''+ pm.environment.get("SCIM_NewUserDefault_preferredlanguage")+'\'');
pm.environment.set("SCIM_NewUserDefault_dataaccesslanguage", "en");    // possible values: 'zz' (default), 'af', 'ar', 'bg',  ... many more as shown above in preferredlanguage.

console.warn(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': SCIM_NewUserDefault_dataaccesslanguage                       : Undefined! Variable set as \''+ pm.environment.get("SCIM_NewUserDefault_dataaccesslanguage")+'\'');
pm.environment.set("SCIM_NewUserDefault_dateformatting", "MMM d, yyyy");    // possible values include: 'MMM d, yyyy', 'dd/MM/yyyy', 'MM.dd.yyyy', ... many more!

console.warn(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': SCIM_NewUserDefault_dateformatting                           : Undefined! Variable set as \''+ pm.environment.get("SCIM_NewUserDefault_dateformatting")+'\'');

console.warn(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': SCIM_NewUserDefault_timeformatting                           : Undefined! Variable set as \''+ pm.environment.get("SCIM_NewUserDefault_timeformatting")+'\'');
pm.environment.set("SCIM_NewUserDefault_numberformatting", "1,234.56");    // possible values include: 'MMM d, yyyy', 'dd/MM/yyyy', 'MM.dd.yyyy', ... many more!

console.warn(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': SCIM_NewUserDefault_numberformatting                         : Undefined! Variable set as \''+ pm.environment.get("SCIM_NewUserDefault_numberformatting")+'\'');
pm.environment.set("SCIM_NewUserDefault_cleanupnotificationsnumberofdays", "0");    // possible values include: 'MMM d, yyyy', 'dd/MM/yyyy', 'MM.dd.yyyy', ... many more!
pm.environment.set("SCIM_NewUserDefault_systemnotificationsemailoptin", "true");    // possible values: 'true' or 'false' are valid, unlike 'TRUE' or 'FALSE'
pm.environment.set("SCIM_NewUserDefault_marketingemailoptin", "false");    // possible values: 'true' or 'false' are valid, unlike 'TRUE' or 'FALSE'

console.warn(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': SCIM_NewUserDefault_marketingemailoptin                      : Undefined! Variable set as \''+ pm.environment.get("SCIM_NewUserDefault_marketingemailoptin")+'\'');
// we got an unexpected response from the SAC API
console.error(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Unexpected error. Response Body: '+ pm.response.text());

item.name: READ repository content (Step 4 - read Repositories endpoint)

exec: console.error(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': A HTTP 401 status was returned. This means this session is not authorised, likely due to an invalid access token. Response Body: '+ pm.response.text());
// Need to set the ContinuousErrors count to 0 as we got a valid response from the API
// load the response into a variable 'resources'
console.info(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Great! A vadid response was obtained. There are '+resources.length+ ' resources in the Repository');

console.log(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+": The /api/v1/Repositories endpoint provides access to resource metadata. The metadata is kept up-to-date and there should be no need to reindex the content. However, there are a few exceptions. One exception is when your SAP Analytics Cloud Service (or tenant) has been migrated by SAP and the resources have been transported from another tenant via a non-conventional route. In this case, the metadata may need to be reindexed. Reindexing the content is needed only once and it can only be performed by a user logged in as the \'System Owner\'. Reindexing is triggered by making a browser-based request to the URL "+trigger_indexing_url+" when already logged in as the System Owner. You should then observe the response for \'status\' to be \'200\'. This indicates the re-indexing has started which typically takes about 15 minutes to complete, but occasionally longer if there is a great deal of content. During this time, the /api/v1/Repositories will return an HTTP response status of 501 and description \'An internal server error has occurred\'. Once the 15 minutes have passed, the endpoint will then return all the content as expected. There may be other exceptions that mean re-indexing might be necessary. Re-indexing should not be a task repeated on any frequent basis, but solely in an exceptional manner. This URL is not documented and thus not fully supported by SAP, even though SAP Support may direct you to make this request and it will often resolve any \'missing\' metadata.");
console.error(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+": No content was found referencing an internal tenant ID. This is not expected.");
// we got an unexpected response from the SAC API
if (!errors) { errors=0 };  // in case errors has not yet been set we need to set it to 0

const maxerrors=parseInt( (pm.environment.get("abort_after_continous_errors_reaches")!=undefined) ? parseInt(pm.environment.get("abort_after_continous_errors_reaches")) : 3 );  // maxerrors should be at least 2 to allow for recovery of invalid access token and csrf tokens
// it means a setting of 1 would mean any call following would not be allowed to re-attempt the call.
// a setting of 3 is recommended to allow at least 1 re-attempted call and any subsequent call also failing for a potentially different reason
console.error(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Too many continuous errors. Aborting. Response: '+ pm.response.text());
console.warn(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Continuous errors detected. Response: '+ pm.response.text());
console.log(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Reading Repositories API endpoint to obtain total resources count. This will validate if the SACserviceFQDN is valid or not.');

item.name: READ activities log (Step 5 - read Activities endpoint)

exec: console.info(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Reading Activities API endpoint to obtain oldest log entry. It will also validate the Activities API endpoint which requires the OAuth Service \'Activities\'');

console.error(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': No access to activities log. The OAuth client may not have been granted access to the \'Activities\' Service, or the access token is not valid. Fetching a new access token');
// in the event SAP Analytics Cloud is receiving too many requests, a HTTP response 429 will be issued.
// in such a case, we shall wait for the 'Retry-After' value and simply re-attempt the same request.
console.info(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': SAP Analytics Cloud is receiving too many requests. Retrying in '+retryafter+'ms');
// Need to set the ContinuousErrors count to 0 as we got a valid response from the API

const total_entries = pm.response.headers.get('epm-page-count'); // the total number of pages there are for this query. Given our pageSize is just 1, this is the numnber of pages, but also then the number of entires in total
console.info(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Great! The a valid response was obtained. This SAP Analytics Cloud Service has '+total_entries+' activity logs');
const lines = pm.response.text().split('\n');  // lines is an array, each element is a row
lines.splice(0, 4);                  // lines has the first 5 lines removed from it, as this is the header
let columns_array = lines[0].split('","');          // split each row into columns
// we have fewer columns than we expect. It means the description column has carriage returns in it and we need to 'shift' the rows below up, and join it to this row, minus the carriage returns
let oldest_date_GMT = columns_array[7] // get the timestamp from row 1 (index0) in the 8th column (index7)
oldestdate_this_time_zone.setHours(oldestdate_this_time_zone.getHours()     + timezone_hours);    // we add (or substract) the hours depending upon the timezone
oldestdate_this_time_zone.setMinutes(oldestdate_this_time_zone.getMinutes() + timezone_minutes);  // we add (or substract) the minutes depending upon the timezone
console.log(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': The oldest log entry found was for '+oldestdate_this_time_zone+' which was '+oldest_activities_log_entry_in_days+' days ago');
// we got an unexpected response from the SAC API
if (!errors) { errors=0 };  // in case errors has not yet been set we need to set it to 0

const maxerrors=parseInt( (pm.environment.get("abort_after_continous_errors_reaches")!=undefined) ? parseInt(pm.environment.get("abort_after_continous_errors_reaches")) : 3 );  // maxerrors should be at least 2 to allow for recovery of invalid access token and csrf tokens
// it means a setting of 1 would mean any call following would not be allowed to re-attempt the call.
// a setting of 3 is recommended to allow at least 1 re-attempted call and any subsequent call also failing for a potentially different reason
console.error(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Too many continuous errors. Aborting. Response: '+ pm.response.text());
console.warn(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Continuous errors detected. Response: '+ pm.response.text());

if (!errors) { errors=0 };  // in case errors has not yet been set we need to set it to 0
